description: Building upon the basis of Japanese 3, this module aims to further develop students' communication skills on daily topics of general interests. It enhances students' socio-cultural awareness and enables them to communicate meaningfully in appropriate manner using more complex grammar structures including passive forms, embedded questions, and a limited set of polite expressions. Approximately 150 kanji will be introduced, and students will be able to write short coherent texts and understand various types of texts including some formal ones.
title: Japanese 4
prerequisite: Passed LAJ2202 or placement test. Student must not have read a higher level module than this module.
